examples: And combatants also enlisted soldiers from colonies and conscripted hundreds of thousands more to do menial labor.
In 1777, Congress recommended a draft to the states and by 1778 most of the fighting states were conscripting men, since voluntary enlistment quotas weren’t being met.

Meanwhile, colonization proved extremely lucrative for Spain and Portugal, which within a century went from being poor kingdoms to astonishingly rich ones, especially after 1545, when the Spanish uncovered a huge deposit of silver in Potosi, in present day Bolivia, and began conscripting indigenous people to do the most dangerous work in the mines.
Neel met James Hunter less than a week before he was scheduled to fight in Vietnam after being conscripted into the U.S. Army.

words.defineVi: làm cho vui hay hạnh phúc

examples: But beyond that, the human brain just can't fathom the scale of the solar system . . .
But as a good Catholic, he couldn’t fathom a world in which God would plant globally false beliefs in all of our minds.
I have a greater responsibility than you can possibly fathom.
And just to kind of fathom the amount of energy that's being released in a supernova, it can temporarily outshine an entire galaxy.
He couldn’t fathom any meaning behind all this endless bloodshed and suffering.
words.defineEn: to understand and make sense of something after giving it a lot of thought
words.defineVi: để hiểu và làm cho ý nghĩa của một cái gì đó sau khi cho nó rất nhiều suy nghĩ

examples: When Iacocca decamped to Chrysler, he took the idea of the minivan with him and the caravan and Voyager models were released soon after.

He failed to pay heed to our advice.
It was a painful reminder that advice is least heeded when most needed.
Rather than heeding cautionary tales from elders, the young woman insisted on learning life's harder lessons firsthand.
words.defineEn: to be attentive to advice or a warning
words.defineVi: để được chú ý đến lời khuyên hoặc một cảnh báo

examples: I am now mired in cheese.

examples: My husband, obviously knows, including some co-workers when the topic is broached.

words.defineVi: đưa ra một chủ đề để thảo luận

examples: Avenge me.

words.defineEn: take revenge for a perceived wrong
words.defineVi: trả thù cho một nhận thức sai lầm

examples: The monkey skillfully plucked the almonds from the tree.

He plucked a vibrant pink mallow flower from the garden and admired its soft petals.
"Oh, I just plucked them out of the air."
Look, this legislation hasn't been plucked from the air.

If it's the president or vice president being impeached, the chief justice of the Supreme Court presides.
Technically, the vice president is the president of the Senate, presides over the Senate most of the time.
The presiding spirit over the Congress and its negotiations was the Austrian minister Prince Klemens von Metternich.
This journey of the Church of Rome which presides in charity over all the Churches.
words.defineEn: to have or act in an authoritative role in a ceremony, meeting, etc.
words.defineVi: để có hoặc hành động trong một vai trò có thẩm quyền trong một buổi lễ, cuộc họp, vv

examples: And she was openly espousing that theme five years ago.

examples: The house seemed to be stuck in a 19th-century time warp.

examples: The field ultimately winnows out.

examples: Jut as the saying goes, parents who are afraid to put their foot down usually have children who step on their toes.

and then the mustard flower jut give it a little kick.
